definition: to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: Black enamel coated snap fasteners on cuff straps and concealed in pocket flaps.
sentences.chinese: 袖口钮袢和袋口暗袋唇打黑色按扣。

sentences.english: The waistband had lost its snap.
Two-way, full-length zip with snap closure storm flap.
sentences.chinese: 双向，全长拉链与按扣风暴皮瓣。

sentences.english: It is essential that all press fasteners for each garment are opened and closed to test their function.
sentences.chinese: 每一件衣服上所有的按扣都必需经过开合功能测试。

sentences.english: It's usually just snap-fitted together. Otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 后盖通常是按扣咬合的。

sentences.english: And snappers and a magnetic object are disposed on the infrared sticking layer.
sentences.chinese: 所述在所述红外粘胶层上有按扣或磁性物体。

sentences.english: Loess, stone, cotton & plastic snap fastener.
Three snap closure up the back for easy on and off.
sentences.chinese: 三了易于打开和关闭背面的按扣。

definition: a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
hidden snap fastener (concealed behind a flap on a garment)
